items.description: 3D Variability Analysis job Beta (requires CUDA 9+)
Support for CUDA 10.1 (recompile cryoSPARC with a newer CUDA Toolkit by using bin/cryosparcw newcuda)
Micrographs with Patch CTF Extraction fail when particles are extracted
Install script for cryoSPARC (new version of anaconda used when installing)
Dependency issue caused numpy functions to fail
CTFFIND4 wrapper crashes when it tries to output failed micrographs
Local Patch-Based Motion Correction Beta
Local Patch-Based CTF Estimation Beta
Create Templates job
Blob picker job
Support for movies produced by K3 Camera (including fixes for quirks of Leginon/Gatan Latitude)
Heartbeat time is now configurable. Addresses problem where long-running jobs stop communicating with the master process intermittently due to network issues.

Network requests between worker and master processes now by default have a 300 second timeout (instead of 120s) and also retry 3 times in case the host is unreachable. This should reduce the occurrence of failed jobs due to network timeout issues or slowdowns of the master process
Ability to mark failed or killed jobs in cryoSPARC as completed allowing it's latest outputs to be used for further processing) - use the 'Mark Job as Complete' button in the Job Details panel
Import .star files now also imports rlnRandomSubset to preserve the gold-standard split and rlnAngle* and rlnOriginX/Y to preserve alignments of particles

Ab-initio reconstruction now has a parameter to limit it to running on only a subset of particles, to more easily deal with very large (million+ particle) datasets. You can use the volumes generated by a 'partial' ab-initio reconstruction as the initial references for a heterogeneous refinement, which will then quickly classify and refine the rest of the dataset
Memory usage for motion correction and picking is now minimized for super-res K3 movies
Box size range in interactive jobs increased to [4, 1024]
MRC Extended header size (NSYMBT) taken into account when reading MRC files
Particles extracted from K3 Movies produced NaN values
MRC mode 0 is now interpreted as uint8 rather than int8, to match Latitude for K3 movies
Power threshold slider in interactive jobs can be more finely controlled
NCC and Power Thresholds for picking are limited to 1st and 99th percentile to reduce number of outliers
Bug in GPU extraction that would cause job to hang indefinitely after starting
Bug in dynamic mask generation in Local Refinement (when Non-uniform Refinement is turned on)
Off-by-one bug in fulcrum selection in Local Refinement
MotionCor2 Wrapper Beta More details
Ability to force reinstall updates More details
Various GCTF Wrapper bugfixes
Certain plots created by GCTF fail to display in Curate Exposures
Template Picker fails to allocate GPU memory
Extract From Micrographs runs out of GPU memory prematurely

cryoSPARC now supports CUDA 9 and 10. Note: Updating to this version will trigger a reinstallation of cryoSPARC dependencies. These are included in the installation bundle and should not cause any issues but updating could take longer than normal
Bug in GCTF wrapper that caused problems when run in per-particle local CTF refinement mode
Bug in exposure curation when some micrographs contained no particles
Wrapper for GCTF Beta More details
Wrapper for CTFFIND 4.1.10 More details
Added lowpass filter option under Volume Tools
Simulate Data Beta job to create particle images from up to two input volumes at random relative and global alignments
Jobs no longer run if required inputs are missing; user is prompted to connect required inputs before queuing is possible
Plotting projections of generated volume in Ab-Initio Reconstruction instead of slices. Refinements still plot slices
CTF error 'binary not found'
CTFFIND same filename issues
CudaFftError on some GPUs in compute-exclusive mode
Revamped job builder with support for low-level result connections, new outputs tab in job details view. Learn more
Backup & Restore cryoSPARC database through the command line. More details
Project directory path now in the project details panel, copy it to your clipboard by clicking on it
Redesigned Select 2D interactive job including support for quick selection (all/none/invert) and sorting classes by number of particles, resolution, and effective classes assigned. Learn more
Volume tools can now be used to invert a mask
Added a volume premultiplier to Particle Subtraction to improve scaling of subtracted projections
Added option to not use halfmaps in Particle Subtraction
cryoSPARC username now available in cluster submission scripts. More details
After queuing a job in the tree view, you will remain in the tree view when the details view is opened
Exposure curation bug fixes (handling NaNs in inputs, can input multiple numerals to edit selections, corrected phase_shift and fit_to values in CTF fit image)
Import volumes saves volume to the correct directory
Volume tools conversion between map/mask volume types
Non-uniform refinement now outputs a mask. Also removed duplicate volume outputs
Use per-particle scale factors in particle subtraction
CTFFIND file path reference pointed to an incorrect location, causing CTF Estimation jobs to fail
Local Refinement Beta and Particle Subtraction Beta jobs - read a detailed tutorial and blog post with usage instructions
Sharpening job for post processing of refinement outputs. Every user should re-sharpen refinement outputs to ensure maximum map quality
Command line option to turn off SSD caching for an entire project
Non-Uniform Refinement fixes for issue that caused peripheral artefacts on some datasets, speedups
Volume tools can now be used to threshold, pad, and dilate masks
Output separate .mrc files for templates included and templates excluded in select2D, for use with other template-pickers
Added phase shifts to Manually Curate Exposures job
Set default amplitude contrast value to 0.07 when importing .star files with particles
Added parameter to specify Negative Stain images in Extract from Micrographs and Local Motion Correction to output particles with correct datasign
Job scheduler now checks if all necessary inputs are connected before launching a job
Bugfixes and performance improvements for Manually Curate Exposures
Users can now delete projects
Bash is no longer required to be the default shell on worker nodes
Creation time displays correctly on projects and workspaces
Added option to limit the number of plots made in Inspect Picks
Local motion correction can now handle empty movies with no particles
Plotting bug in Extract from Micrographs that inverted the printed particles
Volume plots are now created and labelled with the correct axis convention
2D classification CPU RAM allocation increased to avoid crashes on cluster systems
Standalone installation method for single-workstation instances - install cryoSPARC with only one line!
It is now possible to delete workspaces with jobs, a prompt will specify which jobs will be deleted or removed from target workspace
Custom job titles appear as label underneath job cards in the tree view for quick referencing
When creating a new project you now just need to specify a container directory in which cryoSPARC can auto-manage project directory names and contents
The dropdown for linking and moving jobs has been updated to allow for scrolling through many workspaces
Various changes to the interface based on user feedback
Improved stability for refinement of large particles (1024 pixels+)
Users that run standalone instances of cryoSPARC don't require ssh keys to run jobs anymore
Bug where deleted workspaces would show in the project view
Public release of cryoSPARC v2!
Documentation and Tutorial
Resource manager and queue view for active jobs

User isolation: users can now see only their own projects, and choose to select other users to share projects with. Admin users can see all projects. Users can be limited to browse only particular directories
Several UI updates and improvements, filters and searchability for projects and workspaces
New installation and configuration commands
Downsample particles job can now also highpass and lowpass filter particle images
Bug fixes to enable SLURM and other cluster schedulers
Detailed Installation Guide that has details of how to configure cryoSPARC v2, as well as documentation for admin and advanced functions
Volume utility for upsampling, cropping, and flipping maps (for example after importing, or to correct the hand of an ab-initio result)
Added settings for worker nodes to configure SSD cache quota and reserve space, on a per-node basis
Import jobs can now import using environment variables like $HOME
All jobs that use SSD caching now have an option to disable caching
Updates to installation and configuration system, making cluster setup easier
2D classification now has options to recenter and window class references during classification, helpful with crowding or when generating templates for picking. Re-centering is on by default
2D classification now defaults to using colored noise, can yield better results in some cases (thanks to Oliver Clarke)
Many parameter descriptions now expanded
Bugfix in heterogeneous refinement that would cause over-sharpening
Fix bug causing jobs to stall if they require files to be cached that are in use by another job

Exposure curation interactive job: allows population or individual-level inspection, sorting, and selecting subsets of exposures (movies/micrographs) based on CTF estimates, motion trajectories, particle picks, etc.
Multi-GPU motion correction (global and local)
Support for loading mrc.bz2 format movies and decompressing on the fly (using pbzip2)
Wrapper for 3DFSC
Changelog on dashboard
Tweaks/updates to non-uniform refinement Beta
Fixes for GPUs in process-exclusive mode
Fixes in GPU parallelized particle extraction
Various bug fixes
